website_summaries.verdict: It's not the fastest NAS, nor does it include many advanced features, but the WD My Cloud EX4 still combines great ease of use into an affordable personal cloud system that's excellent for a connected home.
pros: The WD My Cloud EX4 offers data redundancy, Windows Server integration, and an excellent set of personal cloud features
It's also affordable and very easy to use
cons: The server's write speed is disappointing
The mobile app supports a limited number of file formats, there's no search function, and it won't allow you to sort by content type

customer_reviews.title: Data loss and very slow write times...do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Western Digital has severally degraded their reputation with this product. This system has incredibly slow write times, which makes it difficult to use with large volumes of data (exactly why you need up to 16TB of storage). Additionally, after "just powering off" the unit, the share and all data was lost. Eventually created a new share and found "some" of my data under the recycle bin, unfortunately not my most important files. I could understand if a hard drive gets corrupted (that's why storage devices like this use RAID), but to have the files just vanish is astounding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: This device is hackable by anyone... SMBv1 !exploits!
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these at our company. The CIFS/SMB file sharing is using SMB v1. We did a white hat hacker penetration test the other day, and the first thing he did was completely take over that device and use it as a jump off point to compromise a lot of other areas. Turns out it has the latest firmware. Turns out a lot of other people have found these vulnerabilities, but WD has not released a firmware update fixing the security issues. Do yourself a favor, disable CIFS/SMB sharing and only use iSCSI.
customer_reviews.author: B. Coverstone

customer_reviews.title: The machine itself is fine, however the unit I received had 3 days ...
customer_reviews.text: The machine itself is fine, however the unit I received had 3 days remaining on the warranty from Western Digital when I called for technical support. Must have been sitting on a shelf somewhere for a year or more before I bought it. I sent them a copy of my Amazon receipt, and they adjusted the warranty time frame to compensate. Instructions and quick start guide were very easy to follow. It's a stand alone box on the network that backs up and stores our data at our business.
customer_reviews.author: BCF

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Champ!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome NAS. I have it hooked up to a seperate network using Jumbo Frames and dishing out iSCSI SAN Shares to both a Windows Server and a VMWARE ESXi Server without any issues. (Just make sure the cards you are using can support Jumbo Frames. I'm using 9000 and this device supports it and so does my dedicated network cards -- caution -- cheap network cards claim they support Jumbo Frames but try to shy away from them). I do wish it had ability for dual networks but this only supports bonded/failover, not two separate networks.
customer_reviews.author: GJW

customer_reviews.title: Careful, AD doesn't work properly and unsecured folder forced on you
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't integrate with active directory like they claim. Hours on the phone with escalation support has yet to yield any help. Also, you're forced to leave the public unsecured, unrestricted share enabled. That's fine at home, but in a SMB, it's stupid to have an unrestricted share on your network. WD isn't interested in removing that "feature" or even allowing owners the right to turn off that "feature".
customer_reviews.author: BSB

customer_reviews.title: great hardware, not so much on the software.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of the software, so I purchased my own software (Acronis True Image 2015...which by the way is hokey and hangs up for unknown reasons, isn't able to communicate correctly what the issue is and rarely lets you "stop" the process to sort out what happened....I've gone weeks w/o backups and it doesn't tell me...but I digress)....the WD enclosure with a couple of Red drives seems to be high quality, reasonable speed when the software works, and so far it's doing it's job. I only gave it 4 stars because I had to go buy my own software (but that software I purchase, while better, blows too).
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Really quiet, good for home but impossible (for me) to integrate with active directory
customer_reviews.text: This device is great for simple home use, but not good for small businesses. While this device would be perfect for home use - it's quiet and easy to set up for most consumer uses, getting it to interact with Active Directory is impossible - It just doesn't work. I've been trying to configure this for 2 days now including an hour on the phone with customer support. Unfortunately, it still doesn't work with my small business' simple AD system running on Windows Server 2008 which has been stable for 5 years and runs computers ranging from Windows 7 to Windows Server 2008. I had to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Bill from Mountain View

customer_reviews.title: All Four Drives Failed Simultaneously, all data lost.
customer_reviews.text: One month out of warranty; all four drives failed simultaneously, completely negating the value of the RAID array in the first place. Response from WD support - out of warranty, so I'm up a creek. Irony is that I'd never had occasion to actually retrieve a backup from this device until my WD My Book Pro failed almost concurrently. Maybe they conspired? I suspect the elf on a shelf may have been involved as well, but can't prove it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding NAS
customer_reviews.text: I am so thrilled to have this. I had a Pogoplug. It worked but kept on going down. I would have to unplug it and then plug it back in so it would work again. You don't know how much a pain that was especially if you were away on a business trip and you needed something from your hard drive. My Cloud EX4 is worth every penny I paid for it. It has plenty of room plus two extra USB ports for more storage. Right now I have 10TB. and I still have three more bay's to add more hard drives. If you are thinking of buying this I say GET IT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: CONFIDENT IT WILL HANDLE DEMANDING ROLE
customer_reviews.text: Looks like high quality piece of equipment. Hard disks slide into bays tightly. Like closing a car door on a BMW. So far, up 100% of the time with no issues. "Dashboard" gives admin good control over setup and monitoring. Only thing I'm not completely clear on is speed. Configured to Raid 0 it still has to pass my speed test. Just haven't done it yet. To summarize: After 45 days of testing, my NAS about to take on high traffic, 24/7 duty as Media server and Family Cloud Service ( dropping Dropbox). I am confident it will handle this demanding role.
customer_reviews.author: wolfy52554

customer_reviews.title: These are great devices, however
customer_reviews.text: These are great devices, however, the documentation that comes with them is almost non-existent and they are a real challenge to set up and get working. Level 1 support, which is in the Dominican Republic is useless; they really don't understand the product or how to get it to work. But Level 2 is helpful. Once working they are wonderful, but be careful. They sent out a "firmware" update, which I applied, and now the device isn't working correctly. Level 2 support says they never saw this before and don't know what to do. They have offered to replace the device but migrating all the info is a hassle. I will try to fix it myself....let's see.
customer_reviews.author: A. FLEW

customer_reviews.title: Its to old
customer_reviews.text: The device its out date, WD costumer support was unable to make the could works. after backing 3 Gb of one of the PC , the device became impossible to respond. so slow that it will take 20 minutes to open the login page. It was attempted from 3 different computers. The web platforms from the device don't exist anymore. 500 mb of ram is just not enough. to deal with 12 TB. I will not recommend this item. you will be losing time and money. On WD website the S/N of this models that warranty expired back in 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner NAS Option
customer_reviews.text: Works Great as a beginner NAS option. It's advertised as 8 TB, though if you are looking to actually have realtime backup, it's best to consider that functionally more like 6TB of space. I get transfer speeds around 50MBs to this box, and use it a primary storage array for a primary and backup media server. It handles action from both no problem, is quiet, and preforms well. I'd recommend it to anybody looking to get started with network storage.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: this device has very few good points. I have had unreliable performance and unreliable ...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this device has very few good points. I have had unreliable performance and unreliable drive diagnostics! These are WD drives in a WD enclosure! wish I could get my money back on the whole thing, and buy a USB portable drive (much more reliable). The interface is Slooooooooooow, and the functionality is poor. User's cannot use their credentials to access shares unless its a public share. I could go on and on, but save yourself the trouble...DO NOT BUY THIS. Im not a newbie to tech...I've been in the business for 17 years.
customer_reviews.author: david a jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: I like this but its failed on me after a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this but its failed on me after a few months. Contacted WD support and it seems they only have like 1 support person or something because it took them forever to get back to me each time I replied to their email back to me.... Now I am awaiting my advance RMA replacement unit, hope it makes it here soon....as long as it took for WD support to get back to me I hope the mailing of the replacement is a bit faster than the email support was. 4 stars only because support response is sooooo SLOW......
customer_reviews.author: CurtisR

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS UNIT! I already had 4 new Red drives sitting here and when this piece came. I dropped them it and it was really a no brainer to get it up and running. It has some very neat features, and it is lacking a few. It will be great when WD gets all of the apps going for it. Now this unit is no speed demon, but it does not cost like one that is. For the money it is a great rock solid value. You want super fast, open your wallet further. For my money this unit is perfect. Plus it is WD! What could be better.
customer_reviews.author: owl9704a

customer_reviews.title: Saved my bacon after a drive crash
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved my bacon last month when my SSD suddenly turned into a brick. Setup can be a bit picky, and you need to make sure you have all the default Windows network discovery turned on, but if you're running a standard version of Windows and you're willing to read a little bit before trying anything fancy, this baby will store a ridiculous amount of data and turn a major disaster into a minor inconvenience. 5 stars because it worked when I needed it with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Duff

customer_reviews.title: Super slow (just insane as slow it is)
customer_reviews.text: This one just a waist of money and a lot of time ! Super slow (just insane as slow it is). And if any think it is reliable, well, im thinking to get back up HDD due to concern of failure. And if it fails, oh boy, month for recovery?! WILL NOT RECOMEND ! Pros: Simple interface Cons: Slow transfer Hard to reach out the dash board New firmware make it slower (old one does not support new features)
customer_reviews.author: Pavlo

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, Massive capacity, WD reputation
customer_reviews.text: Practically flew out of the box by itself. Seriously, plugged it in and started using it. It was instantly discovered by my WD Live TV box and my Samsung Smart TV. Again no set up, just plugged it in. All my MACs found it so now I have instant time machine backups and of course it is on my network so I can access it from anywhere. Who needs to pay for someone elses cloud when you can have your own. Now excuse me while I go rip 9 million DVD's to it.
customer_reviews.author: Porgy Tirebiter

customer_reviews.title: I'M in the Cloud!!
customer_reviews.text: All in all for the price a good NAS unit. It has a very robust case and the screen gives you some quick basic info on the unit, IP address, fan speed, unit temp. It is a little slow uploading initial data dump but not too bad. The setup software is straight forward and easy to use. The apps are good but could be improved upon. The music app need to be able to view and manipulate the music better. You cant make playlists or search by genre, artist etc.
customer_reviews.author: Coheeba

customer_reviews.title: this piece of junk is super slow. After removing all my content and storing ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk box. I bought the EX4 with 16TB almost 2 years ago. WD uses under powered processing and firmware for something that is more complex. Even after several updates, this piece of junk is super slow. After removing all my content and storing it in something much more reliable and a lot faster, I couldn't bring myself to resell the base unit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a personal cloud that would do all the things that this does with ease and realiability. I am able to put movies or documentaries on this cloud and from anywhere in my house and am able to watch them without a hitch. I use my Kindle HDX frequently and it has never dropped a single clip over the last month that I have used it. ... And also, with the Hard Drives I had on had here at home, I have been able to use them in this Cloud perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: BRICKED PAPER Weight... DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok all be it slow for 200 days.... Then I did a firmware upgrade and that improved the terribly slow UI but performance was still slow Then I set the device to have a fixed IP and it bricked the device. I cannot get back to my data. the reset button on the back does nothing It hangs when rebooting needing a power cycle. I have lost all my data now and have $999.00 foot stool I will never buy another WD product based on this experience. SAVE YOUR MONEY LOOK AT SOMETHING ELSE
customer_reviews.author: Al Mcd.

customer_reviews.title: Great Network Storage
customer_reviews.text: What a great no-fuss way to get some cloud storage with local redundancy! As a SysAdmin, I like being able to get into the guts via an SSH session, but the GUI is great too. Neat little apps for desktop and mobile users - get your files anywhere and be in control of them! Tool-less drive install/replacement and dual power supply/network options make this a serious contender for business class or power users!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S Judd

customer_reviews.title: It does not work well with Windows 10, which ...
customer_reviews.text: It does not work well with Windows 10, which keeps forgetting how to connect to it every time Windows is rebooted. Also shut down makes it hang (for days), so you end up having to pull the power plug and wait a long time for a "file system integrity check" before you can change any settings to try to fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Todd D. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Solid but Slow for Time Machine
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a Time Machine backup. Some days (I have a 3am backup scheduled and if I've modified lots of files, may start it at bedtime) it shows 1GB/hour estimates & speeds, which seems a little slow. Then again, the box I replaced was about that fast and corrupted the backups when I used a speedier option, somaybe the Apple backup sw is doing a lot of stuff that GBs doesn't account for.
customer_reviews.author: Walter A. French

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but the web interface is pretty slow
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but the web interface is pretty slow. I am using the Plex app to play movies off of it, but the processor is very limited and results in several issues. I will need a dedicated PC for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awful! After I changed the drive name and ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awful! After I changed the drive name and setup a mycloud account, I changed the user name and password. It immediately gave me a user error warning saying that the system had timed out then logged me out. Never to let me back into the dashboard again. Resetting the unit did not work nor did system restore to get it back to factory default. The 2nd unit did the EXACT same thing. I returned both (the last of which for a refund). This unit is almost WORTHLESS as WD's technical support which is quite simply NONEXISTENT. (Emphasis mine).
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Baker, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Using the NAS for shared disk access is working fine. However
customer_reviews.text: Using the NAS for shared disk access is working fine. However, I've run into two issues: 1 - Plugging in USB drives causes the system to lock up - there are fixes on the net for turning off services that scan USB devices for media files, but these involve Linux shell commands (which I have no problem with), but this should not be happening 2 - If you resize the Time Machine disk space for your Mac, it will cause the time machine to delete the current backups and start over - this is probably not a bug with the NAS, but still bothersome
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wimberg

customer_reviews.title: Great device. but tends to get hot in summer.
customer_reviews.text: Great value and fast NAS. Ran perfect for the most part of a year. Only down side is in summer when it tends to get hot in the middle east. And when im writing a 1 or 2 tb of data to it. The temp of the machine reaches 70. And at times even shuts down due to the heat to protect the drives. Also it lacks apps which is really the biggest down side. Doesent compare to synology or Qnaps offering. But thwn again its not as expensive. So i guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Osama Ebrahim Ali

customer_reviews.title: Too Slow, bad firmware and software
customer_reviews.text: This thing was fine when new. They immediately started doing firmware updates. They are not very good at that. The thing is sooooooo sloooooow now it is unbelievable. The support is very bad too. Very disappointed with Western Digital. I have asked for the old firmware multiple times and get no response.
customer_reviews.author: Steven E Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best NAS yet!
customer_reviews.text: I took a bit of time to configure but tech support was great. One drive failed in 2 months of use and was replaced in 2 days. The NAS is FAST!!! and each day I use it more as I learn it features. It was expensive but I would buy it again in a heartbeat! If your care for your data, this is the "ticket". I no longer even think of data loss and that is very comforting.
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to be able to access files remotely
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough as of today, 3/27/15, but was a nightmare before. One of the automatic updates bricked the unit, after I'd moved all my files over. I should have had a separate backup but didn't. Luckily after a few weeks WD sent a replacement unit and I was able to put the drives back in, in the same order, and it was back to normal. The recent update seems to have cleared up some issues. It's nice to be able to access files remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Musgrave

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - but
customer_reviews.text: The backup software that comes with the system hard to use and I could not get it to work so ended up buying third party backup software. The Raid 5 setup I have did crash but raid 5 is supposed to do it rebuilt itself over a day + with no date loss that I can find. So again far so good after a little over a month.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Great Out of the Box functionality.
customer_reviews.text: This holds all my movies and I can watch them from anywhere on anything. I love the power and flexibility this provides without the complication of building my own NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W

customer_reviews.title: Web interface is great, combined with the 4- 4TB Western Digital Red ...
customer_reviews.text: Web interface is great, combined with the 4- 4TB Western Digital Red hard drives this thing is great. Web access is also a plus for checking backups on the run. Use this with Backup exec and it works great. Network speed is a little slow but for a NAS solution I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Abies Alba

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little unit that has worked perfectly since commissioning. The only problem I ran into was getting the dashboard to function during deployment. 45 minutes of technical support (however courteous and professional) were not able to resolve the issue, so I finally plugged it directly into a Windows 8 machine (not on the network) and Bingo! everything worked. There I changed some of the network settings, returned it to the network, and everything was fine. I suppose that a more experienced user would have avoided the trouble entirely, but overall I can recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy E Hochstetler

customer_reviews.title: Plugged it in, set it up, it works
customer_reviews.text: Use it on the network. Receives files from the scanner; everyone had their own folder, etc.Also use it to back up the network server file storage.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Young

customer_reviews.title: very good product, ability to access your files from anywhere ...
customer_reviews.text: very good product, ability to access your files from anywhere via WD2go login. (requires some tech know how to setup) Not the greatest file transfer speed, took me 48 hours to transfer my 5TB worth of data to it. (cannot add drives to a volume in a raid) Ability to raid 4 internal drives and create volumes for 2 external (USB) drives,
customer_reviews.author: Woofie

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but needs More CPU and RAM
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little unit for home use but it's underpowered in CPU and memory, so don't expect great performance from it for large transfers or for many concurrent users.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Beware the BOX!!!
customer_reviews.text: The box has yet to work correctly! I assumed that I was doing something wrong because after reading manual I figured this was going to be easy. Unfortunately the drives constantly show as failing and crashes constantly. I've replaced the drives multiple time and nothing seems to work. Because the unit was only going to serve as a backup of our backups I didn't spend much time on it after each failure.....so I missed the deadline to send the unit back, so I'm stuck with a $600 paperweight. Don't waste your money, learn from my experience and go elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Adler

customer_reviews.title: so far so good, BUT
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars as at first glance it looks serviceable. I've messed with this and have added some accounts; so far so good, BUT, only the shadow know what lurks in the hearts of logic circuits. P.S. I've trusted WD for many years and expect no less w this Cloud unit.
customer_reviews.author: DuGo2Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great storage but avoid iSCSI
customer_reviews.text: After several months of use, so far I really like it, but WD's iSCSI setup and reliability is awful. So much so, I've stopped using it because I ended up having to delete an iSCSI volume I was using for TV recordings that just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: imjin

customer_reviews.title: Good Boat Anchor
customer_reviews.text: I have two words. BOAT ANCHOR. This server is slow and finicky. I have to reboot it a lot. Searching for files is impossible. I had issues with it after I had it for a month and when I called WD for tech support, they told me the warranty had expired. The worst part of that was the warranty expired 2 months before I purchased the server. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Beckie Hawk

customer_reviews.title: No complaints here
customer_reviews.text: After I put in the Red disks I bought, the server started right up. I was able to quickly go through all the configuration screens and setup the PLEX app without any trouble. I have been streaming my movies and music with it since day 1 and have yet to experience any trouble either on my network or remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Glacier Drive
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 16T model. Arrived setup with RAID5 leaving about 11.8T for raw storage. Never seen a drive so slow. Does not connect readily to network
customer_reviews.author: Lakehouse

customer_reviews.title: Slow. Takes forever to boot up and even longer ...
customer_reviews.text: Slow. Takes forever to boot up and even longer to shut down. CPU isn't powerful enough to transcode many video files via Plex server. Wordpress install is a VERY old version and I haven't been able to update it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Levi

customer_reviews.title: Great device for price point
customer_reviews.text: This NAS out performs the Netgear ReadyNAS Arm processor line hands down, while it is no Synology,etc... unit for the price you pay its a good buy. I recommend you get it with the 16TB (4x4TB Red) preloaded as it is cheaper than buying the drives separately. The speed is respectable for what you pay, if you want over 50mb/s you need to spend much more money to get an Atom based unit like Synology,etc...
customer_reviews.author: The Shoppinator

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT have Plex Media Server support!
customer_reviews.text: Plex Media Server no longer supports this device. It used to, but doesn't anymore. From the Plex support forums: "The EX4 CPU/chipset is Marvell Kirkwood 2.0 GHz Single-Core. There are no devtools avaialble for Kirkwood anymore as the development support for this processor stopped years ago."
customer_reviews.author: rsimandl

customer_reviews.title: Home based backup and online access
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a home backup device and a way to access my files when I'm not at home. Great product and good price with tons of storage capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan O

customer_reviews.title: I like it but configuration was a bit confusing
customer_reviews.text: I like it but configuration was a bit confusing... But I would buy again just to store files that I can access with my router.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Small package but great capacity.!
customer_reviews.text: We have a small office with 6 PC's we are all able to use it it was easy to install and it works fast enough! I still have to figure some stuff out but it's ok for now. Working through the Internet is a breeze and just as fast as in the office. Great little box!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Clements

customer_reviews.title: Like old WD  EX475
customer_reviews.text: This unit is just as bad as the old WD backup unit EX475. It does not backu the computers that I have on my network. I installed teo 3TB drives and it is still not giving me the correct information.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great as a NAS, not a Cloud
customer_reviews.text: People who say it's slow are either crazy, or set it up wrong. It's blazing fast and... really just incredible. So why 3 stars? Very simple really. Great hardware, bad software. Not really even comparable to the capabilities of a normal cloud service like Dropbox.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Business Product!
customer_reviews.text: These work great as storage for a small office. They can also be a great iSCSI disk based backup target at 1/4 of the price of enterprise iSCSI disk enclosures.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected or needed.  Very glitchy software.
customer_reviews.text: Slow and Glitchy. Would not work for what I need which was just a simple external back up solution for my image files. Returned it immediately. The software for it is browser based and stalled out constantly....just not worth the frustration for me.
customer_reviews.author: highcountry

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: This unit has worked first time out of the box. Easy to install ( need to follow instructions carefully), works as expected, can breath better now that its installed.
customer_reviews.author: RKG

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it to power users or smal businesses
customer_reviews.text: Before firmware update it was giving me disk error and was saying optimized to work with wd red nas drives after firmware update it works with different brand disk without any warning. Works fast, quite and silent. I recommend it to power users or smal businesses:)
customer_reviews.author: Taner Imamoglu

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome. I mean, what else do you need to know.
customer_reviews.text: I've got mine in a RAID 5 configuration which means that I've got around 8.75 TB of space. It was a good purchase. Easy to install. Solid performance. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Windham

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Great box, granted it's the first one I've used like it. Currently I have 2 4tb drives installed, and adding 2 more this week. Easy set up, quick to get started. Using with my 27" Apple iMac, and Yosemite 10.10.3.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Riegler

customer_reviews.title: Worth having
customer_reviews.text: Getting plenty of use. Interface a little clunky. Has taken a while to learn to navigate user, security settings. I would, and have recommended to friends.👍
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Works as home cloud drive on high speed hub or router
customer_reviews.text: After a few month of use, it is still works fine without any problem. You will need to have a high speed hub or router, otherwise the transfer speed would not be good at all.
customer_reviews.author: SensingHand

customer_reviews.title: Self-update bricked the unit.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded the firmware via the self-update feature. Unit bricked itself in the process.
customer_reviews.author: dan powers

customer_reviews.title: Terrible read speeds and even worse write speeds
customer_reviews.text: Half-baked Activity Directory integration that does not work. Terrible read speeds and even worse write speeds. Don’t waste your money and buy QNAP or build your own solution with FreeNAS
customer_reviews.author: carlospzx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home digital media needs.
customer_reviews.text: A must buy for any home network that has digital media. Used as raid10 for redundancy. Out of the box with apple time machine. 8TB with raid10 might be a little light.
customer_reviews.author: Isacksen F.

customer_reviews.title: Consider carefully
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but it's operating system is slow, and support is poor. Also the public folders cannot be secured, which is a major security issue for which WD should know better.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Read the online manual for the version of this that you get. This is very easy to setup but also easy to screw up if you don't read the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Pir

customer_reviews.title: Slow and sometimes nonfunctional
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this NAS. I have to keep rebooting it at least twice a week in order to get a decent response from it. When I log on to the admin site, the cpu is pegged at 100%. A reboot fixes the cpu issue. Accessing files is not as fast from our windows 8.1 computers. Before buying this, shop around and read all the reviews. It is time for me to call WD to complain.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Device
customer_reviews.text: After spending countless hours over the past 2 weeks trying to get two 3TB WD Red drives to format and a few hours on the phone with WD Technical Support, I give up on this device. Note: after packing this product for shipping back, I then inserted both 3TB drives into an ANTEK USB Hard drive adapter and formatted both disks. Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Mikala

customer_reviews.title: Solid.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for over a year now and it works flawlessly. Good speed, great reliability, and all the capacity I needed.
customer_reviews.author: tiberius

customer_reviews.title: Crashed repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: Price and space were good but this crashed on me 3 times in the first day. Returned and exchanged for the DL4100
customer_reviews.author: J. Duider

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: it's decent, but the read/write speeds are not even close to my 2 year old Netgear NAS box...
customer_reviews.author: Richard P Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to figure out vs Plug and Play. This = impossible
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this as a back up and its a nightmare of confusion compared to the MyBooks. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Mike90125

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is the same as others have posted ...
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the same as others have posted, the speed of writing is abysmal. 20 Mbs on a 1Gbs network. That's from a USB 3 device where I can normally get 90 Mbs transfers
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: zero stars
customer_reviews.text: Really dissapointed with Western Digital. So slow even with 1000gbps ethernet. Want to throw it to the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Seamless
customer_reviews.text: Does the job quickly, you'll forget it's there. Seamless compatibility with Windows 7, 8 and Server. Perfect for storing HUGE multi-track audio products or graphics.
customer_reviews.author: M. Burns

customer_reviews.title: ... it for a year now and cannot say anything bad about good item from Western Digital the hot swap ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for a year now and cannot say anything bad about good item from Western Digital the hot swap is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Mrriver

customer_reviews.title: this unit is awesome. I am now loading it with a bunch ...
customer_reviews.text: this unit is awesome. I am now loading it with a bunch of movies for a cloud throughout the family. It holds a lot of data. I can't wait till I get it finished.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Orner

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, feature packed, and simple to use but still so powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a while and was almost about to settle and build a NAS from scratch when I found this. The interface is so easy to use and the features in the apps on your devices and the ones built in to the operating system make this incredibly powerful yet simple and easy to use. I love the simplicity of opening the app and it just connects no fuss no mess.
customer_reviews.author: michael mcgough

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely satisfied with this equipment and is ease of use. set up is a breeze and access to your cloud from anywhere with virtually any device is outstanding. WD has perfected the personal cloud with this unit. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Little pain in the butt, but firmware upgrades over time have resolved most of the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Rippey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great unit - easy install - lots of space (configured as Raid 5 for secure b/u) - works flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cumming

customer_reviews.title: Works on your local network ok but...
customer_reviews.text: Do not hold your breath to have Internet access. I have tried several different configurations of port forwarding, it does not work. Nor does the "automatic" configuration or what is as referred to as relay. The box just says attempting to connect but never does. As for a local network back up device it works well enough, I have not tried much else. If I can get the port forwarding to work I would raise the rating. I do like the way it is built, the raid drives are easy to access, and even though the reviews say it is slow, for home use it is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and access through the My Cloud ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I have 8TB set up for personal backups. Easy to set up and access through the My Cloud App.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bachman

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This backup /cloud works as advertised. The WD My Cloud EX4 makes me feels more confident that I'll not loose data.
customer_reviews.author: Greg FD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great NAS fast and very reliable and redundant storage with RAID. Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Sal Delorenzo

customer_reviews.title: To Early to Tell
customer_reviews.text: I have read the reviews and purchased this NAS as the price was right, but, you get what you pay for. It is slow and I am concerned I made the wrong choice. This NAS doesn't like to be pushed and found when I am doing multiple tasks it cannot keep up thus I lose my dashboard access. I am hopeful WD gets the firmware updated and improves this little NAS. For a mac user, it does allow for time machine backups however i just received an error message about time machine cannot validate the drive so it is starting a new back up!
customer_reviews.author: BBJ

customer_reviews.title: works fine - no issues
customer_reviews.text: works fine, no problems. waking up from standby mode can take a few seconds (standby mode interval is adjustable), but otherwise no issues during video streaming or file transfers.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Not the fastest in the market, but worthy the money
customer_reviews.author: CADS

customer_reviews.title: best investment plus priced better than a 3 rb drive
customer_reviews.text: Superb.. best investment plus priced better than a 3 rb drive .. performance 5 star speed 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Juan E. Ariza

customer_reviews.title: the RAID system failed after 3days of using it,
customer_reviews.text: the RAID system failed after 3days of using it ,but WD support team is still not able to help me after 12 days of chasing behind them and spending 2 hours of international phone calls since i don't have a support number in Saudi Arabia.
customer_reviews.author: younes almanameen

customer_reviews.title: Not for on demand use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is SLOW. I had it hooked up for about an hour before I decided to ship it back. Speeds about 50MB regardless of which raid version using gigabit and 4 disks. In comparison I built a small desktop and setup linux software raid on it for about 500, and it runs at about 120MB a second. If you just want to store stuff and don't have any technical knowledge, this might work for you. If you want to stream data across your network, don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Monster video server
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the easiest NAS I have ever worked with. Turned it on and copied all of my media from various drives to the NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Price

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Trouble free config and works well as our Video and music server
customer_reviews.author: Dave Camilleri

customer_reviews.title: Garbage performance
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, just look at the supplier forums about performance issues on this device, backing up 100GB takes a day over the network. Creating a backup of an existing USB drive made the system unresponsive. Installed 2x WD red drives 4TB in RAID 1 configuration.
customer_reviews.author: alessm

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to deploy, Reliable. Well documented. Support was fantastic. What else to you want? I wish this exact appliance was available in a 1u or 2u rackmount (without adding thousands $$ to the price).
customer_reviews.author: jimnipp

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Drive is good, but support leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for people who need safe cloud storage.
customer_reviews.text: I love western digital! This thing is awesome! I found this very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: carl lundoy

customer_reviews.title: my WDmyClued EX4 experience
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product as it works well. It does what I wanted. The only problem I have is its speed as his is not a very fast NAS but you can always manage if you use fast hard drives (SATA III) and both 1 Gb Ethernet ports together (2 Gb). I like that you can access it using your mobile device and also works well over the internet (cloud). Safety and security is also very good as I use a RAID 1 (mirror) array for important files with user access controls, etc. and a JBOD arrangement for streaming music and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Isaac Gobern

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS, supports rSync!
customer_reviews.text: Works well out of the box. With SSH access it even supports rSync.
customer_reviews.author: MBrando

product_meta.title: WD My Cloud EX4 16 TB: Pre-configured Network Attached Storage featuring WD Red Drives
product_meta.description:
Capacity:16 TB

MY CLOUD EX4 PERSONAL CLOUD STORAGE – ULTIMATE RELIABILITY FROM THE TRUSTED NAME IN STORAGE. 
Built from the ground up with the quality and reliability you've come to expect from WD, My Cloud EX4 is a high-performance, four-bay NAS for your home or small office. It offers a robust all-metal enclosure, multiple RAID volumes, easy drive installation, and a full suite of apps for the power and flexibility to expand your NAS features.

Featuring WD Red drives
My Cloud EX4 works right out of the box with integrated WD Red hard drives for ultimate compatibility in the unique 24x7 NAS operating environment. Pre-set in RAID 5 mode for ultimate protection for your data from the start.

Easy to set up, easy to manage
Effortlessly install drives or hot swap within five seconds with WD's advanced, all-metal enclosure design. WD's powerful dashboard means you are always in control.

Extensive data protection
You're armed with multiple options to secure your data from loss. Choose RAID 1, 5, 10 or select from spanning and JBOD modes for even more options to manage your data.

Ultimate reliability - Built from the ground up with the quality and reliability you've come to expect from WD.

Your options are endless - Choose the diskless enclosure with easy drive install and hot swap to effortlessly add up to four drives and grow as your needs expand. Or, choose a populated system that works right out of the box, featuring WD Red hard drives for ultimate compatibility in the unique 24x7 NAS operating environment. 

High-performance NAS - Dual Ethernet and power supply ports; 512 MB memory and 2.0 GHz processor deliver reliable, blazing-fast performance for your home or small office. 

Drive management and data protection at its best - You're armed with multiple options to secure your data from loss. Choose RAID 0, 1, 5, 10 or select from spanning and JBOD modes for even more options to manage your data.

Easy to manage - A powerful dashboard and LCD display means your system is always under your control. Monitor your drives, manage users, and utilize energy-saving features. Email and mobile alerts keep you informed on My Cloud EX4 status. 

Award-winning desktop and mobile apps - With WD's My Cloud mobile and desktop apps, you can upload, access and share your documents from anywhere. Conveniently transfer files from your public cloud service to the My Cloud EX4 directly from the mobile app. 

Powerful apps to customize your NAS - Featuring industry-leading apps, including aMule, Icecast, Joomla!, phpBB, phpMyAdmin, and SqueezeCenter. 

Advanced serving options - Integrated file server, FTP server, backup server and P2P torrent download server.

Stream media to your connected devices - Stream videos and photos to connected TVs, media players, gaming consoles and other DLNA/UPnP devices. Features a Twonky 7.2 and a DLNA-certified 1.5 media server. And with My Cloud EX4's iTunes server, you can easily stream your music collection.

Back up, your way - Protect your data with remote backup to another My Cloud EX4, integrated cloud backup or local LAN/WAN backup. PC users, WD SmartWare Pro offers options for how, when and where you back up your files for up to ten computers. Mac users, utilize all the features of Apple Time Machine backup software to protect your data. 

Increase your personal cloud capacity - Simply attach a compatible USB hard drive directly to one of the two USB 3.0 expansion ports on My Cloud EX4 and instantly expand your storage capacity.

Integrated energy-saving features - Save money on your energy bill with disk spin-down and scheduled power on/off. 

Your own personal cloud - Unlike public clouds, My Cloud EX4 allows you to keep all your content in one safe place on your home or office network instead of a remote server. No mysterious location of your data. No monthly fees. No limits. Just blazing-fast performance for your high-speed digital life. 

Advanced features - iSCSI target, full-featured FTP services, link aggregation and failover support, jumbo frame support, iPv6 ready, UPS support (USB and network), real time resource monitor, volume encryption with boot-up password, SNMP, and virtual volumes. 

My Cloud EX4 personal cloud storage products work concurrently with multiple operating systems including Mac OS, Windows 8, iOS and Android with mobile apps.

Ideal for

 * Centralizing and organizing your data in one secure location
 * Securing your data from loss with customizable disk management and multiple RAID options
 * Backing up files automatically from all the PC and Mac computers on your network
 * Streaming all your media files on your network
 * Quickly installing drives with ease
 * Saving, backing up and sharing your stored content from anywhere
 * Accessing and saving files securely from any computer, tablet, and smartphone
 * Uploading photos and videos directly to your personal cloud to free up space on your mobile devices
 * Transferring files between your public cloud accounts and My Cloud EX4

What's in the box
Four-bay personal cloud storage, Ethernet cable, power supply and cable, Quick Install Guide.

Compatibility
Windows 8.1 or earlier, Windows 7, Windows Vista or Windows XP (SP 3) operating systems
Mac OS X Mavericks, Mountain Lion, Lion or Snow Leopard operating systems
DLNA/UPnP devices for streaming
Internet connection for remote access

Supported Browsers
Internet Explorer 8 or higher
Safari 6 or higher
Firefox 21 or higher
Google Chrome 27 or higher on supported Windows and Mac OS platforms 

Note: Compatibility may vary depending on user's hardware configuration and operating system.

Features at a glance

 * Four-bay enclosure, 0 – 16 TB
 * Dual Gigabit Ethernet
 * Dual USB 3.0 expansion ports
 * 2.0 GHz processor
 * 512 MB of system memory
 * PC/Mac compatible
 * RAID 0, 1, 5, 10; JBOD, spanning
 * Easy drive install and hot swap
 * Twonky 7.2 DLNA 1.5 & UPnP certified media server
 * Anywhere access from computers, tablets, and smartphones with My Cloud desktop and mobile apps
 * A full suite of third-party apps
 * iTunes support
 * Dual power and network redundancy
 * Optimized for WD Red drives with WD's exclusive NASware technology


For more great WD products, visit the Western Digital Store at Amazon.com
feature_bullets: Reliable, high-performance, four-bay NAS for your home or small office
Diskless enclosure for ultimate flexibility or a populated system that works out of the box
User-selectable drive management with RAID 0, 1, 5, 10 as well as spanning and JBOD modes
Get up and running quickly with easy drive installation or buy a populated version that works right out of the box
Easy to manage with a powerful dashboard, LCD display and drive status alerts
Industry-leading third-party apps, including aMule and Icecast
Advanced serving options including an integrated file server

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars340 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
